Detailed Description

template<typename VarArray, typename ValueArray, typename VarSum>
struct LiteralSumConstraintDynamic< VarArray, ValueArray, VarSum >

constraints;litsumgeq Description The constraint litsumgeq(vec1, vec2, c) ensures that there exists at least c distinct indices i such that vec1[i] = vec2[i]. constraints;litsumgeq Notes A SAT clause {x,y,z} can be created using:

litsumgeq([x,y,z],[1,1,1],1)

Note also that this constraint is more efficient for smaller values of c. For large values consider using watchsumleq. constraints;litsumgeq Reifiability This constraint is not reifiable. constraints;litsumgeq References See also

help constraints watchsumleq help constraints watchsumgeq

Definition at line 230 of file dynamic_literalwatch.h.

template<typename VarArray, typename ValueArray, typename VarSum>
virtual bool LiteralSumConstraintDynamic< VarArray, ValueArray, VarSum >::get_satisfying_assignment ( box< pair< int, DomainInt > > &  assignment  )  [inline, virtual]

Looks for a valid partial assignment to a constraint.

The return value (in the box) is pairs of <varnum, domain value>, where varnum is in the same position as returned by get_vars.

Reimplemented from AbstractConstraint.
